com.mindfusion.scheduling

Class ItemDrawContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.scheduling.ItemDrawContext

  • public class ItemDrawContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides information about an item being drawn by an item viewer.

      • drawDefault

        public void drawDefault(java.awt.Rectangle bounds)

      • drawHeaderBorder

        public void drawHeaderBorder(java.awt.Rectangle destination)
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Renders the header frame around the specified rectangle.

        This method renders a border around the specified rectangle using the settings from the underlying style, such as Style.getHeaderBorderLeftColor(), Style.getHeaderBorderLeftWidth(), and so on. Since the style is based on the current theme, the rendered frame is guaranteed to be theme independent, that is, the color and thickness of the frame, unless overridden, are the same as those specified in the current theme. If the theme is changed, the color and thickness are updated accordingly.

        Parameters:
        destination - The rectangle in which to render the item.

      • drawBorder

        public void drawBorder(java.awt.Rectangle destination)
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Renders the frame around the specified rectangle.

        This method renders a border around the specified rectangle using the settings from the underlying style, such as Style.getBorderLeftColor(), Style.getBorderLeftWidth(), and so on. Since the style is based on the current theme, the rendered frame is guaranteed to be theme independent, that is, the color and thickness of the frame, unless overridden, are the same as those specified in the current theme. If the theme is changed, the color and thickness are updated accordingly.

        Parameters:
        destination - The rectangle around which to render a border.

      • drawHeaderText

        public boolean drawHeaderText(java.awt.Rectangle destination,
                              boolean useSettings,
                              boolean rotate)
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Renders the item's header text at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        destination - A reference to the destination rectangle. This rectangle might be changed in the process of rendering.
        useSettings - Specifies whether to take into consideration validation properties, such as ItemSettings.getEnableDefaultRendering(). Specify false for this property to perform unconditional rendering.
        rotate - Specifies whether to rotate the text at 90 degree.
        Returns:
        true if the text has been rendered; otherwise, false.

      • drawContentsText

        public boolean drawContentsText(java.awt.Rectangle destination,
                                boolean useSettings,
                                boolean rotate)
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Renders the item's contents text at the specified location.

        This method renders the Item.getDescriptionText() of the underlying item using the settings from the underlying style, such as Style.getTextColor(), Style.getTextAlignment(), and so on. Since the style is based on the current theme, the rendered text is guaranteed to be theme independent, that is, the color and font of the text, unless overridden, are the same as those specified in the current theme. If the theme is changed, the font and color are updated accordingly.

        Parameters:
        destination - A reference to the destination rectangle. This rectangle might be changed in the process of rendering.
        useSettings - Specifies whether to take into consideration validation properties, such as ItemSettings.getEnableDefaultRendering(). Specify false for this property to perform unconditional rendering.
        rotate - Specifies whether to rotate the text at 90 degree.
        Returns:
        true if the text has been rendered; otherwise, false.

      • drawFormattedContentsText

        public boolean drawFormattedContentsText(java.awt.Rectangle destination,
                                         boolean useSettings)
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Renders the item's contents text at the specified location. Some HTML tags within the item text are recognized and rendered accordingly.

        This method renders the Item.getDescriptionText() of the underlying item using the settings from the underlying style, such as Style.getTextColor(), Style.getTextAlignment(), and so on. The method also takes into consideration some HTML formatting tags, such as <b>, <i> and <color>. Since the style is based on the current theme, the rendered text is guaranteed to be theme independent, that is, the color and font of the text, unless overridden, are the same as those specified in the current theme. If the theme is changed, the font and color are updated accordingly.

        Parameters:
        destination - A reference to the destination rectangle. This rectangle might be changed in the process of rendering.
        useSettings - Specifies whether to take into consideration validation properties, such as ItemSettings.getEnableDefaultRendering(). Specify false for this property to perform the rendering unconditionally.
        Returns:
        true if the text has been rendered; otherwise, false.

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(java.awt.Image image,
                      java.awt.Rectangle bounds,
                      ImageAlignment alignment)
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Draws the specified image in the specified rectangle, using the specified alignment.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to draw.
        bounds - The destination rectangle.
        alignment - The alignment to use when drawing.

      • drawStartClock

        public boolean drawStartClock(java.awt.Rectangle destination,
                              boolean useSettings)
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Draws a clock icon representing the item's start time at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        destination - A reference to the destination rectangle. This rectangle might be changed in the process of rendering.
        useSettings - Specifies whether to take into consideration validation properties, such as ItemSettings.getEnableDefaultRendering() and ItemSettings.getShowClocks(). Specify false for this property to perform unconditional rendering.
        Returns:
        true if the icon has been rendered; otherwise, false.

      • drawEndClock

        public boolean drawEndClock(java.awt.Rectangle destination,
                            boolean useSettings)
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Draws a clock icon representing the item's end time at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        destination - A reference to the destination rectangle. This rectangle might be changed in the process of rendering.
        useSettings - Specifies whether to take into consideration validation properties, such as ItemSettings.getEnableDefaultRendering() and ItemSettings.getShowClocks(). Specify false for this property to perform unconditional rendering.
        Returns:
        true if the icon has been rendered; otherwise, false.

      • drawRecurrenceIcon

        public boolean drawRecurrenceIcon(java.awt.Rectangle destination,
                                  boolean useSettings)
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Draws an icon representing the item's recurrence state at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        destination - A reference to the destination rectangle. This rectangle might be changed in the process of rendering.
        useSettings - Specifies whether to take into consideration validation properties, such as ItemSettings.getEnableDefaultRendering(), ItemSettings.getShowRecurrenceIcons() and ItemSettings.getShowRecurrenceExceptionIcons(). Specify false for this property to perform unconditional rendering.
        Returns:
        true if the icon has been rendered; otherwise, false.

      • drawReminderIcon

        public boolean drawReminderIcon(java.awt.Rectangle destination,
                                boolean useSettings)
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Draws an icon representing the item's reminder at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        destination - A reference to the destination rectangle. This rectangle might be changed in the process of rendering.
        useSettings - Specifies whether to take into consideration validation properties, such as ItemSettings.getEnableDefaultRendering() and ItemSettings.getShowReminderIcons(). Specify false for this property to perform unconditional rendering.
        Returns:
        true if an icon has been drawn; otherwise, false.

      • getCalendar

        public Calendar getCalendar()
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Gets the Calendar component, associated with the item.

        A class can be set as an item viewer using the ItemViewerAttribute attribute.

        Returns:
        The Calendar object associated with the item viewer.

      • getItem

        public Item getItem()
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Gets the item that is being drawn.
        Returns:
        The schedule item that must be painted by the item viewer.

      • getGraphics

        public java.awt.Graphics2D getGraphics()
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Gets the target graphics object.

        A custom item viewer should use this Graphics2D instance to draw a schedule item.

        Returns:
        An instance of the Graphics2D interface that must be used to paint the item.

      • setGraphics

        public void setGraphics(java.awt.Graphics2D value)
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Sets the target graphics object.

        A custom item viewer should use this Graphics2D instance to draw a schedule item.

        Parameters:
        value - An instance of the Graphics2D interface that must be used to paint the item.

      • getBounds

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Gets the rectangle bounding the item contents.

        The item viewer must paint the item inside these bounds.

        Returns:
        A Rectangle object.

      • getStyle

        public Style getStyle()
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Gets the style that should be used to draw the item.
        Returns:
        The Style for the item being painted.

      • getIsAllDayEvent

        public boolean getIsAllDayEvent()
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Gets a value indicating whether the item is an all day event or not. The item is always considered an all day event if it is drawn outside of a Timetable view.
        Returns:
        true if the item being painted is an all-day event; otherwise, false.

      • getIsHorizontal

        public boolean getIsHorizontal()
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Gets a value indicating the item's orientation.

        Items are painted horizontally or vertically depending on the orientation of the current view.

        Returns:
        true if the item is painted horizontally; otherwise, false.

      • getStartsHere

        public boolean getStartsHere()
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Gets a value indicating whether the item part being drawn is the first part of the item.

        Items consist of several parts when they span several time cells in the month, list and week range views.

        Returns:
        true if the first part of an item is being painted; otherwise, false.

      • getEndsHere

        public boolean getEndsHere()
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Gets a value indicating whether the item part being drawn is the last part of the item.

        Items consist of several parts when they span several time cells in the month, list and week range views.

        Returns:
        true if the last part of an item is being painted; otherwise, false.

      • getIsMilestone

        public boolean getIsMilestone()
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Gets a value indicating whether the item is rendered in milestone mode.
        Returns:
        true indicates that the item is currently laid out and rendered in milestone mode, that is, the EnableMilestoneMode property of the ListViewSettings class is set to true; otherwise, false.

      • getPointed

        public boolean getPointed()
        Description copied from class: ItemDrawContext
        Gets a value indicating whether the mouse is over the drawn item.

        You can inspect the value of this property if you intend to change the appearance of your items when the mouse hovers over them. For example, you might wish to implement some form of highlighting.

        Returns:
        true if the mouse is currently over the item; otherwise, false.
